title: RSPCA rescues ladder-scaling badgers from Torfaen canal
description: Two badgers are rescued after they became stuck while trying to scale a ladder out of a canal.

title: Covid: What is the government doing about the South Africa variant?
description: The new strain was reported in South Africa on 18 December.

title: Myanmar coup: Police clamp down as protesters defy ban on gatherings
description: Water cannon is deployed again as thousands take to the streets despite a ban on mass gatherings.

title: Covid: HMP Stocken outbreak 'behind Rutland's surge'
description: The rate of infection has more than tripled across England's smallest county.

title: Chinese regulators throw spanner in Tesla's works
description: Elon Musk's electric vehicle firm has been summoned over quality and safety issues with its cars.

title: Trump impeachment: Senate paves way for speedy trial of ex-president
description: The former president goes on trial in the Senate on Tuesday, accused of inciting mob violence.

title: Britain's Watson through in Australian opener
description: Heather Watson beats Kristyna Pliskova to reach the Australian Open second round, despite a 14-day quarantine limiting her preparations.

title: The Papers: Call to tighten borders and PM 'puts faith in Oxford jab'
description: Prof Jonathan Van-Tam's remarks that the South African coronavirus variant is no cause for panic feature on many of the front pages.

title: Covid: Travellers to UK set to be tested after arrival
description: The new testing regime, to be announced soon, is aimed at tracking cases and detecting new variants.

title: Whatever happened to local TV?
description: A decade ago, the government set out a plan for channels to be "a new voice for local communities".

title: Robinhood: US family sue trading app over son's suicide
description: The parents of Alex Kearns, 20, say he thought he had lost $730,000 when he took his own life.

title: Lockdown: How religious services have been changed by Covid
description: Three religious leaders tell Radio 1 Newsbeat how they've adapted their services in the pandemic.

title: Covid: Support 'repeatedly skewed towards men', say MPs
description: Gender inequalities in the economy have been ignored in the pandemic, a Commons committee says.

title: Covid-19: NHS app has told 1.7 million to self-isolate
description: Ministers believe the contact-tracing app has prevented 600,000 cases of the disease in England and Wales.

title: Hyundai: The carmaker aiming to become a tech firm
description: Hyundai is making a name for itself as an innovator, even though talks with Apple have fizzled out.

title: Brexit effect: No custard creams for Brits in Europe
description: A British supermarket chain in Belgium is on the verge of closure with no deliveries since December.

title: Australian Open: How the event is trying to stay Covid-safe
description: Tens of thousands of tennis fans are being allowed in each day to watch, after a three week delay.

title: Covid-19: Downton Abbey's Hugh Bonneville is vaccine marshal
description: Hugh Bonneville has been surprising people queuing for the vaccine at a hub near his home.

title: Night exercise: Top tips to exercise safely
description: One consequence of lockdown has been that neighbourhoods come to life after dark.
